messages: a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (06:22): via markp on #whatwg :
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (06:22): http://www.crockford.com/html/
c5e3539121c4944f2bbe097b425ee774 (06:37): re: crockford article, I don't understand why you need a version... seems silly.
c5e3539121c4944f2bbe097b425ee774 (06:38): argh.. I'm not reading any more
c5e3539121c4944f2bbe097b425ee774 (06:38): <meta http-equiv=content-script-type content=application/ecmascript> was enough!
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (06:39): c5e3539121c4944f2bbe097b425ee774 - I wonder if the <module> idea is worth discussion.
c5e3539121c4944f2bbe097b425ee774 (06:40): yeah, maybe... but still don't think it's any better than Iframe... not that he talks about it in any detail
c5e3539121c4944f2bbe097b425ee774 (06:41): takes a look at json module
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (06:41): I wonder if he has actually read the HTML5 spec (the real one, I mean)
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (06:41): or if he is aware of the related work in the Web API WG
c5e3539121c4944f2bbe097b425ee774 (06:42): from skimming, seems that  eventsource does what he what he wants
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (06:50): re-reads #public-html logs and finds http://krijnhoetmer.nl/irc-logs/html-wg/20070409
1adba86c435b5fe0f7ea043370b1636b (06:52): you mean #html-wg logs
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (06:53): 1adba86c435b5fe0f7ea043370b1636b - yeah
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (06:53): &lt a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2>     was there ever any discussion on the whatwg list of Douglas Crockford's proposal for a <module> tag?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (06:53): &lt a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2>     element
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (06:53): &lt a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2>     http://json.org/module
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (06:53): <anne>  yeah, I think so
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (06:53): <anne>  but it seems that cross-site XHR and cross document messaging cover both...
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (06:53): &lt a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2>     ah, yeah
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (06:54): <anne>  no need for JSONRequest and <module>
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (06:54): &lt a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2>     yeah, I found the thread and reading it now
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (06:54): &lt a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2>     anne - Web API WG is working on spec'ing (or adopting spec for) cross-document messaging? or planning to?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (06:54): <anne>  nope
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (06:54): <mjs>   what is <module>?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (06:54): &lt a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2>     mjs - something that Douglas Crockford wrote a proposal for
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (06:54): &lt a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2>     http://json.org/module
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (06:54): &lt a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2>     http://lists.whatwg.org/pipermail/whatwg-whatwg.org/2006-October/007522.html
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (06:54): <mjs>   sounds like cross-document messaging will work just as well w/o having to introduce a new element
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (06:54): <mjs>   I wish Doug Crockford would follow HTML standards work more closely if he wants to make proposals like that
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (06:54): <anne>  he made that proposal on the whatwg list ages ago
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (06:54): <anne>  i think since then he's sort of convinced that cross-doc is the way to go
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (06:54): <anne>  but i'm not entirely sure
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (06:54): damn, that's longer than I thought it was
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (06:54): sorry
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (06:54): anyway, it seems that Doug appears to be not yet convinced
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (06:55): and also that my memory really sucks
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (06:56): wanders of to eat lunch, which will hopefully improve his memory for the afternoon
